title: The Myth of the bush
creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Open Learning Agency of Australia and Berry-Anne Billingsley
brief_description: Looks at the Heidelberg School of artists who are considered to be the first group of painters to capture the unique colours of the Australian landscape. Traces the artists’ history from their beginnings at Box Hill where Tom Roberts painted “Artists Camp”, to their first exhibition which concentrated on paintings executed at Heidelberg.
